legal.dataSource: We use data that we receive through your Azure Active Directory account.
legal.purpose:
The Materials App Center (MAC) is a web application that provides an overview of various specially developed web applications, giving you access to the services provided by Schaeffler Materials Technologies. You have the possibility to access the following web applications: Hardness Converter, Materials Supplier Database, AQM Calculator and Lifetime Predictor.

In this context, we process your personal data exclusively on an anonymous basis in order to enable the following evaluations:

  • • Evaluations of request rates, response times and error rates of the website to find out which pages are most frequently used at what times of the day and where the users are located.
  • • Evaluations of page views and loading performance of the website
  • • Evaluations of the number of users and sessions
  • • Evaluation of user-defined events and metrics

Furthermore, we process your personal data in order to enable the following evaluations on our overview page:

  • Which web application is clicked on by the user and thus started.

In the various web applications on our overview page, the following data is tracked:
In the Hardness Converter web application, you can record hardness as well as output unit. We can track your input.
In the Materials Supplier Data Base web application, Co2 values of orderable materials are assigned to different suppliers. In this case, your entry will be tracked.
With the AQM Calculator web application, chemical compositions of steels can be aligned with existing standards. The user can provide information on elements. This information is tracked by us.
The Lifetime Predictor web application is used to predict the service life of different materials under certain loads. The user can enter material parameters and load parameters. This information is tracked by us.

ltp.accessDeniedReasonMessage: This er­ror might like­ly be re­la­ted to mis­sing roles for this con­tent.
ltp.accessDeniedSolutionDescription: Please talk to the res­pon­sible per­sons and re­quest the per­mis­sions for this tool.
ltp.analyticModelHint: these parameters only affect analytical models
ltp.countNAInfo: The expected lifetime cannot be projected for Predictions using R values other than 0 or -1.
ltp.countText: Ex­pec­ted life­time at stress am­pli­tude of
ltp.disclaimer:
This ML-Tool serves as a de­mon­stra­tor and is not ment to be used for as­sess­ment of com­po­nents
If you have any ques­tions, please con­tact Matthias Funk.

chart.confidenceInner: Scatter of the ML Modell from Testing (slog)
chart.legendDescription: The Models are vizualized as SN-curves. The Machine learning model and the analytical Murakami-Model present a 50% probability of survival (Pü). The FKM-model relates to a 97.5% probability of survival. The Parameters of the SN-curve are the slope k, the inflection Point Nk and the load level of the fatigue strength Sa.

display.infoDisplay: Analytical models, e.g. following the FKM-guidline or the Murakami model can be chosen. Additionally a slider allows to define the scatter as a 'slog' (logarithmic deviation). A conservative value might be around 0.045.
display.infoHv: The local hardness in Vickers (HV10) is our primary influence for the generation of a artificial SN-curve. The hardness could be defined directly via a slider or the hardness can be derived from histroical data from the PLS (ger. for Prozessleitsystem). In that case you need to know your material and heat treatment.
display.infoLoad: Additional information on the loading is required for a lifetime prediction. For example the R-value for a swelling or alternating loading.
display.infoMaterial: Besides the hardness some other material parameters, e.g. roughness an residual stress have an influence on the artificial SN-curve. With the corresponding sliders you can configure your material in more detail, what should lead to a more precise prediction. Attention: Some material parameters are only connected to the data driven material model. Step by step we want to include all parameters to the data driven model.

ltp.rrelInfoLong: Our ML-model is trained for predictions at R = 0 and -1. For other R-values between -1 and 0.3 a transformation of the fatigue strength with use of the mean stress sensitivity is performed.
ltp.rrelInfoShort: No prediction for LCF-range, see info-i
ltp.title: Life­time Pre­dic­tor
